site.title: Gustav Schwarzbach
site.description: Digital portfolio of Gustav Schwarzbach – Media Computer Science student with projects in game design, UI and programming.
site.author: Gustav Schwarzbach

hero.title: Gustav Schwarzbach
hero.subtitle: Media Computer Science Student
description: I'm Gustav Schwarzbach, a Media Computer Science student in the 5th semester at HTW Dresden – tech-savvy, creative and curious. I’m especially fascinated by the combination of technology and creativity – whether in games, animation or design.

Over the past years, I’ve gained practical experience in software development and design – from Java, C++ and C# to .NET and Processing, as well as UI design and 3D modeling. Right now, I'm especially into Blender – my focus is on 3D animation.

I’m an open-minded and helpful person who enjoys working in teams and diving deep into exciting projects. This site showcases some of my work – feel free to explore and get inspired. Who knows, maybe it leads to an interesting collaboration.

about.title: About Me
about.description: I enjoy working on projects that combine technology with design. I’m especially interested in game mechanics, visual storytelling and digital forms of expression – from user interfaces to 3D animation.

skills.title: Design
skills.description: UI/UX, visual storytelling, 3D modeling and texturing

skills.title: Tools
skills.description: Blender, Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, Visual Studio, IntelliJ, WebStorm, Rider

contact.title: Let's Connect
contact.description: I'm always open to exchange, collaboration or joint projects – whether in games, design or technology. Feel free to reach out if you have an idea or are just curious.

projects.title: Semester 1 to 3
projects.description: Insights into the early stages of my studies – from initial programming projects to interactive applications, UI concepts and first games.

folders.title: Design Basics
folders.description: Design assignment on layout, typography and structure. The task was to create a fictional website or brochure based on learned design principles. I designed a complete web presentation for an imaginary chocolate company in Adobe InDesign.

images.title: Homepage
images.description: Cover page with emphasis on text-image hierarchy and clean typographic layout.

images.title: Store (Overview)
images.description: Product display with rating system and CTA buttons, laid out in InDesign with crop marks.

images.title: Contact
images.description: Contact form with structured layout and visual consistency.

images.title: Imprint
images.description: Legal page design with typographic coordination.

images.title: Product Presentation
images.description: Focused product display with balanced layout of image, price and text.

folders.title: GIO Projects
folders.description: In the module 'Designing Interactive Interfaces' (GIO), we analyzed existing websites and redesigned or extended them focusing on structure, design and user guidance.

images.title: Forum Jonas Kaufmann
images.description: Extension of an artist’s site with a fan forum. Applied principles: organization, structure, modules and clear separation of content and interaction.

images.title: Günter Schulte Homepage
images.description: Redesign of a portfolio homepage with focus on elegance, simplicity, proportion and contrast. Goal: expressive and visually minimal presentation.

images.title: City Website Wehlen
images.description: Complete redesign of an outdated municipal website using the 4+1 principles of design (proximity, alignment, repetition, contrast and focal point).

images.title: Nature Finds City
images.description: Independent design for an environmental project by the city of Dresden. Created with and without AI tools based on core communication design principles.

folders.title: Connect Four in C++
folders.description: As part of the Programming II module, I developed a fully functional Connect Four game in C++. The focus was on object orientation, user guidance and stable game logic. The result includes a structured menu, a tutorial system and a graphical multiplayer mode. A short demo shows the gameplay flow.

images.title: Main Menu
images.description: Modern game menu with navigation and basic settings.

images.title: Tutorial System
images.description: Visual guide explaining the rules and controls.

images.title: Multiplayer
images.description: Game scene in local multiplayer mode showing player turns.

images.title: Gameplay Demo
images.description: Short gameplay video showing typical interactions.

folders.title: HandBird – Multimodal Java Game
folders.description: In the module 'Multimodal Human-Computer Interaction' we developed a game in Java using the Processing library. It is controlled via hand movement, voice input or mouse (only in the menu). The goal was to technically implement different forms of interaction. Our solution: a Flappy-Bird-inspired game with camera-based hand tracking.

images.title: Main Menu
images.description: Start screen with camera integration and gesture recognition.

images.title: Gameplay
images.description: Flight through obstacles, controlled by hand movement via camera.

images.title: Game Over
images.description: End scene showing score and high score.

images.title: Gameplay Demo
images.description: Short video demo of the game with live hand control.

projects.title: Semester 4 to 6
projects.description: Advanced projects focused on software architecture, 3D graphics, web technologies and multimodal interaction. Besides C#/.NET, complex applications in areas like computer graphics, audio/video processing and interactive systems were covered.

folders.title: Computer Graphics
folders.description: In the Computer Graphics module, I created a detailed assignment reconstructing a historical building based on preservation blueprints. In the lab, we learned modeling and texturing techniques through smaller projects (cube, shield, temple, etc.).

images.title: Building Reconstruction Exterior
images.description: Part of a 3D reconstruction of a listed building in Saxony. The model is based on historical blueprints.

images.title: Building Reconstruction Interior
images.description: Interior structure of the reconstructed building. The project scope was large and not fully completed.

images.title: Render Shield
images.description: Exercise on modeling, UV unwrapping and material creation for a shield with emblem and sword.

images.title: Shield Wireframe
images.description: Wireframe view of the model to analyze geometry.

images.title: Temple Model
images.description: Practice project on building classical architectural forms and using proportions.

images.title: Temple Details
images.description: Close-up of temple columns focusing on materiality and structure.

images.title: Cube in Glass
images.description: Scene practicing glass, transparency and shader effects with an animated dice throw.

images.title: Cube Close-up
images.description: Detail view focused on light refraction, reflection and material settings.

folders.title: C# & .NET
folders.description: As part of the elective module, I completed several tasks to learn the fundamentals of C# and the .NET framework. Shown here are two selected projects: a custom drawing application and a chat system using client-server communication via sockets.

images.title: Custom Drawing Application
images.description: A mini paint app with drawing tools, color selection, line styles and text function.

images.title: Server-Client Chat
images.description: A multi-user chat implemented via socket connection with server control.

images.title: C# Project Demo
images.description: Short video presentation of the drawing application and the server-client chat.

folders.title: EIiA – Grading via Random System
folders.description: As part of the 'Development Tools for Multimedia Systems' module, the web application 'GambleTheMark' was created. The goal was to automate grade assignment based on subjective factors using a weighted random algorithm. A wireframe (Miro), a design prototype (Figma) and an interactive click dummy (Nordcraft) were developed.

images.title: Miro Wireframes
images.description: Conceptual layout of all pages with navigation and interactions.

images.title: Figma Prototype
images.description: Design system with typography, color, UI components and sample views.

images.title: Interactive Prototype
images.description: Initial functional prototype built in Nordcraft.

images.title: Demo Video
images.description: Demonstration of the implemented application in Nordcraft.

folders.title: Annual Calendar PWA
folders.description: In the module 'Internet Technologies I', I developed a progressive web app that displays an interactive annual calendar for the federal state of Saxony. The app dynamically calculates holidays, displays calendar weeks according to ISO 8601, and can be installed on devices as a PWA. In addition to various views (year, month, mobile), I paid special attention to UI/UX.

images.title: Current Year
images.description: Display of the current year with marked today and holidays.

images.title: Year Selection
images.description: Dropdown selection for calendar years with optional month focus.

images.title: Example Year 2002
images.description: Display of past years with dynamically calculated holidays.

images.title: Color Coding
images.description: Legend distinguishing dynamic and static holidays and calendar structure.

images.title: Mobile View
images.description: Responsive design on a mobile device with focus on current month.

images.title: Tablet View
images.description: Tablet mode with monthly overview and navigation.

folders.title: Eventify – Event Management System
folders.description: In the Software Engineering 2 module during the 4th semester, we implemented the project we had conceptualized in the 3rd semester. I was responsible for team coordination, backend development and project management to ensure a complete, functional and timely submission. I was regularly present, engaged and one of the few consistent contributors. Still, my professor gave me a 1.7, even though I was one point short of a 1.3 – despite me asking several times if a higher grade was possible...

images.title: Homepage
images.description: Landing page prompting event creation and showing upcoming events.

images.title: Create Event
images.description: Input form for a new event with all relevant data fields.

images.title: All Events
images.description: List of all created events with filtering and details.

images.title: Your Tickets
images.description: Overview of your tickets with cancellation option.

folders.title: Short Film – Media Production
folders.description: In the Media Production module, we produced a complete short film using the techniques we learned – including 5.1 surround sound and Blu-ray mastering. The focus was on the interplay between image and sound within professional production workflows.

images.title: Film Demo
images.description: Excerpt from the produced short film with surround sound and postproduction.

projects.title: Work at Blayze Games
projects.description: From August 2021 to December 2022, I was part of the support and QA team at Blayze Games. I handled community communication, tested new builds and documented bugs. In addition to my technical role, I also created store graphics for Google Play and the App Store, event renders for social media and custom skins for the game – even beyond my active time.

folders.title: Forward Assault – Store Page Visuals
folders.description: During my time at Blayze Games, I was tasked with completely overhauling the store graphics for Google Play and the Apple App Store. The goal was to deliver visually appealing and thematically consistent images that clearly highlight gameplay, modes, map variety and skins. This was the result.

images.title: Main Visual
images.description: Key image for the store page – focus on characters and weapons.

images.title: Bomb Defuse
images.description: Visual for the bomb defuse mode – typical game scenario.

images.title: Combat
images.description: Depiction of intense team battles on a realistic map.

images.title: Maps
images.description: Collage of multiple maps – emphasis on visual variety.

images.title: Gamemodes
images.description: Illustration of different game modes – from TDM to Bomb Defuse.

images.title: Skins
images.description: Focus on cosmetic variety – skins for knives, rifles and pistols.

images.title: Sniper TDM
images.description: Visual for sniper mode – precision gameplay in focus.

images.title: TDM
images.description: Standard team deathmatch scene with typical game environment.

folders.title: Forward Assault – Event Renders
folders.description: During my time at Blayze Games, I was also responsible for visual content related to community events. These renders were created for special occasions like Halloween, New Year's or winter events and were used on social media and in-game.

images.title: Halloween Event
images.description: Render for the Halloween community event, matching the dark atmosphere.

images.title: New Year's Greeting
images.description: New Year’s render with fireworks and characters celebrating the turn of the year.

images.title: Skin Showcase
images.description: Character render with custom-designed skins for an eSport teaser event.

images.title: Winter Event
images.description: Sledding scene as a humorous contribution to the winter event – with snow particles and Santa hats.

folders.title: Forward Assault – Skins
folders.description: After my active time at Blayze Games, I continued to design additional skins in my free time – from gloves to knives. Some of these designs were later added to the game. Here’s a selection of that work.

images.title: Skin Offer Overview
images.description: Visual overview of all designed skins with glove and Beretta unlocks.

images.title: Blossom
images.description: Animated product render of the Blossom knife with floral texture.

images.title: Red Blue
images.description: GIF render of the two-tone Red Blue skin – glitchy aesthetic included.

images.title: Webbed (GIF 1)
images.description: Second GIF preview of the Webbed skin.

images.title: Webbed (GIF 2)
images.description: First animated product render of the Webbed skin.

images.title: RIP II
images.description: GIF preview of the RIP II skin – aggressive red-black theme.

folders.title: Bullet Force – Character Renders
folders.description: For the game Bullet Force, I created several renders of the new playable character models. The goal was to showcase the models in various poses with proper lighting setups. These renders were used in marketing materials and for presentation purposes.

images.title: US – Rifle
images.description: Render of a US soldier with assault rifle – focus on gear details and aiming pose.

images.title: US – Pistol
images.description: Render of the US soldier with drawn pistol – highlighting alternate weapon loadout.

images.title: RU – Front View
images.description: Frontal render of a Russian soldier with AK – realistic pose and lighting.

images.title: RU – Rear View
images.description: Rear render of the Russian character showing equipment and back detail.

folders.title: Bullet Force – Steam Page Visuals
folders.description: For the planned update of the Steam presence of Bullet Force, I created new graphics. The goal was to establish a modern and consistent visual concept for the various display formats within the Steam library.

images.title: Library Capsule
images.description: Capsule graphic for compact view in the Steam library – dark background with strong character silhouette.

images.title: Library Header
images.description: Horizontal banner for the Steam library – character pose in red light with weapon focus.

images.title: Library Hero
images.description: Main graphic for the Steam page – atmospheric render with US character model in combat pose.

folders.title: Kukri Knife – 3D Model and Animations
folders.description: During my 4th semester and semester break, I completely modeled and textured a Kukri knife in Blender. Using a rig from Forward Assault, I created FPS animations and designed various skins. Additionally, I created shop offers in Adobe Illustrator intended for the game. Unfortunately, the knife didn't make it into the game due to feedback that '...it doesn't match the quality of the ingame animations like the ones...'

images.title: Default Design
images.description: The base Kukri knife rendered in Blender – completely self-modeled and textured.

images.title: Epic Voltage Skin
images.description: Electric Voltage skin for the Kukri – with glowing accents and special material design.

images.title: Shop Offers
images.description: Shop graphics designed in Adobe Illustrator for various Kukri skins and offers.

images.title: FPS-Animation
images.description: An FPS animation was created in Blender and sound was added in Adobe using free sounds.

content.heading: Liability for Content
paragraphs: As service providers, we are liable for own contents of these websites according to Sec. 7, para. 1 German Telemedia Act (TMG). However, according to Sec. 8 to 10 German Telemedia Act (TMG), service providers are not under obligation to permanently monitor submitted or stored information or to search for evidences that indicate illegal activities.

Legal obligations to removing information or to blocking the use of information remain unchallenged. In this case, liability is only possible at the time of knowledge about a specific violation of law. Illegal contents will be removed immediately at the time we get knowledge of them.

content.heading: Liability for Links
paragraphs: Our offer includes links to external third party websites. We have no influence on the contents of those websites, therefore we cannot guarantee for those contents. Providers or administrators of linked websites are always responsible for the contents of the linked websites.

We checked the linked websites for possible violations of law at the time of the establishment of the link. Illegal contents were not detected at the time of the linking. A permanent monitoring of the contents of linked websites cannot be imposed without reasonable indications that there has been a violation of law. Illegal links will be removed immediately at the time we get knowledge of them.

content.heading: Copyright
paragraphs: Contents and compilations published on these websites by the providers are subject to German copyright laws. Reproduction, editing, distribution as well as the use of any kind outside the scope of the copyright law require a written permission of the author or originator.

Downloads and copies of these websites are permitted for private use only. The commercial use of our contents without permission of the originator is prohibited. Copyright laws of third parties are respected as long as the contents on these websites do not originate from the provider. Contributions of third parties on this site are indicated as such. However, if you notice any violations of copyright law, please inform us. Such contents will be removed immediately.

content.heading: 1. Privacy at a Glance
paragraphs: General Information: The following information provides a simple overview of what happens to your personal information when you visit this website. Personal information is any data that can be used to personally identify you.
This website does not use cookies and does not collect personal data. There is no tracking and no data transmission to third parties.

content.heading: 2. Hosting
paragraphs: This website is hosted via GitHub Pages. The provider GitHub, Inc. may automatically collect certain technical information, such as your IP address.
For more information about GitHub's privacy practices, see the GitHub Privacy Policy: https://docs.github.com/en/github/site-policy/github-privacy-statement

content.heading: 3. Contact
paragraphs: When you contact us by email, the data you provide will be stored for the purpose of processing your inquiry and for follow-up questions.
This data will not be shared without your consent.

content.heading: 4. Your Rights
paragraphs: You have the right to free information about your stored personal data, its origin and recipients and the purpose of data processing, as well as a right to correction or deletion of this data at any time.
For this as well as for further questions about personal data, you can contact me at any time at the address given in the imprint.
